    Welcome to MESS 2014 Workshop’s documentation!¶

    mess2014.mess2014.align_phases(stream, event, inventory, phase_name, method='simple')[source]¶

    Aligns the waveforms with the theoretical travel times for some phase. The theoretical travel times are calculated with obspy.taup.

    Parameters:
    • stream (obspy.core.stream.Stream) – Waveforms for the array processing.
    • event (obspy.core.event.Event) – The event for which to calculate phases.
    • inventory (obspy.station.inventory.Inventory) – Station metadata.
    • phase_name (str) – The name of the phase you want to align. Must be contained in all traces. Otherwise the behaviour is undefined.
    • method (str) – Method is either simple or fft. Simple will just shift the starttime of Trace, while ‘fft’ will do the shift in the frequency domain. Defaults to simple.
    mess2014.mess2014.array_analysis_helper(stream, inventory, method, frqlow, frqhigh, filter=True, baz_plot=True, static3D=False, vel_corr=4.8, wlen=-1, slx=(-10, 10), sly=(-10, 10), sls=0.5, array_response=True)[source]¶

    Array analysis wrapper routine for MESS 2014.

    Parameters:
    • stream (obspy.core.stream.Stream) – Waveforms for the array processing.
    • inventory (obspy.station.inventory.Inventory) – Station metadata for waveforms
    • method (str) – Method used for the array analysis (one of “FK”: Frequnecy Wavenumber, “DLS”: Delay and Sum, “PWS”: Phase Weighted Stack, “SWP”: Slowness Whitened Power).
    • filter (bool) – Whether to bandpass data to selected frequency range
    • frqlow (float) – Low corner of frequency range for array analysis
    • frqhigh (float) – High corner of frequency range for array analysis
    • baz_plot (str) – Whether to show backazimuth-slowness map (True) or slowness x-y map (False).
    • static3D (bool) – static correction of topography using vel_corr as velocity (slow!)
    • vel_corr (float) – Correction velocity for static topography correction in km/s.
    • wlen (float) – sliding window for analysis in seconds, use -1 to use the whole trace without windowing.
    • slx ((float, float)) – Min/Max slowness for analysis in x direction.
    • sly ((float, float)) – Min/Max slowness for analysis in y direction.
    • sls (float) – step width of slowness grid
    • array_response (bool) – superimpose array reponse function in plot (slow!)
    mess2014.mess2014.array_transfer_helper(stream, inventory, sx=(-10, 10), sy=(-10, 10), sls=0.5, freqmin=0.1, freqmax=4.0, numfreqs=10, coordsys='lonlat', correct3dplane=False, static3D=False, velcor=4.8)[source]¶

    Array Response wrapper routine for MESS 2014.

    Parameters:
    • stream (obspy.core.stream.Stream) – Waveforms for the array processing.
    • inventory (obspy.station.inventory.Inventory) – Station metadata for waveforms
    • slx ((float, float)) – Min/Max slowness for analysis in x direction.
    • sly ((float, float)) – Min/Max slowness for analysis in y direction.
    • sls (float) – step width of slowness grid
    • frqmin (float) – Low corner of frequency range for array analysis
    • frqmax (float) – High corner of frequency range for array analysis
    • numfreqs (int) – number of frequency values used for computing array transfer function
    • coordsys (string) – defined coordingate system of stations (lonlat or km)
    • correct_3dplane (bool) – correct for an inclined surface (not used)
    • static_3D (bool) – correct topography
    • velcor (float) – velocity used for static_3D correction
    mess2014.mess2014.attach_coordinates_to_traces(stream, inventory, event=None)[source]¶

    Function to add coordinates to traces.

    It extracts coordinates from a obspy.station.inventory.Inventory object and writes them to each trace’s stats attribute. If an event is given, the distance in degree will also be attached.

    Parameters:
    • stream (obspy.core.stream.Stream) – Waveforms for the array processing.
    • inventory (obspy.station.inventory.Inventory) – Station metadata for waveforms
    • event (obspy.core.event.Event) – If the event is given, the event distance in degree will also be attached to the traces.
    mess2014.mess2014.show_distance_plot(stream, event, inventory, starttime, endtime, plot_travel_times=True)[source]¶

    Plots distance dependent seismogramm sections.

    Parameters:
    • stream (obspy.core.stream.Stream) – The waveforms.
    • event (obspy.core.event.Event) – The event.
    • inventory (obspy.station.inventory.Inventory) – The station information.
    • starttime (UTCDateTime) – starttime of traces to be plotted
    • endttime (UTCDateTime) – endttime of traces to be plotted
    • plot_travel_times – flag whether phases are marked as traveltime plots in the section obspy.taup is used to calculate the phases
    mess2014.mess2014.vespagram(stream, ev, inv, method, frqlow, frqhigh, baz, scale, nthroot=4, filter=True, static3D=False, vel_corr=4.8, sl=(0.0, 10.0, 0.5), align=False, align_phase=['P', 'Pdiff'], plot_trace=True)[source]¶

    vespagram wrapper routine for MESS 2014.

    Parameters:
    • stream (obspy.core.stream.Stream) – Waveforms for the array processing.
    • inventory (obspy.station.inventory.Inventory) – Station metadata for waveforms
    • method (str) – Method used for the array analysis (one of “DLS”: Delay and Sum, “PWS”: Phase Weighted Stack).
    • frqlow (float) – Low corner of frequency range for array analysis
    • frqhigh (float) – High corner of frequency range for array analysis
    • baz – pre-defined (theoretical or calculated) backazimuth used for calculation
    • scale (float) – scale for plotting
    • nthroot (int) – estimating the nthroot for calculation of the beam
    • filter (bool) – Whether to bandpass data to selected frequency range
    • static3D (bool) – static correction of topography using vel_corr as velocity (slow!)
    • vel_corr (float) – Correction velocity for static topography correction in km/s.
    • sl ((float, float,float)) – Min/Max and stepwidthslowness for analysis
    • align (bool) – whether to align the vespagram to a certain phase
    • align_phase – phase to be aligned with (might be a list if simulateneous arivials are expected (P,PcP,Pdif)
    • plot_trace – if True plot the vespagram as wiggle plot, if False as density map
